attributes.action: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to Withdraw Draft Licensing and Registration of Clubs (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) Order 2007
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Licensing laws foster binge drinking which costs >£20bn per year according to the official cabinet office report. This proposed order extending licensing hours will make a bad situation worse. £20bn is 3x the tax revenue from the sale of alcohol - evidence for a reduction in licensing hours not an increase. The media point out that research indicates binge drinkers could be causing rapid damage to their brain cells. Study on rats show that 2 days of binge drinking is enough to cause damage to an area of the brain called the ‘olfactory bulb’, responsible for smell - damage to other regions occurs after 4 days. Professor Michael Collins, Loyola University Chicago, said "It is possible that neuronal degeneration after a couple of days of heavy intoxication in the rat might translate to the human drinker who is not even a chronic alcohol abuser." Department of Social Development is called upon to withdraw this order and work to promote healthier drug-free lifestyles.
